content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like it

Nice idea!
A ")" is missing in line 2 after "(2, 4, 6, 8, ...)".
Can you fix it?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like the idea with the tea customers and the tshirt :D

I like this idea! :D 

I had to I re-read the beginning three times to get the meaning. The example clarified it for me. I think it was because of this sentence:
"Your customers have lined up, so that every other customer orders tea starting with the second one (so every second customer orders tea (2, 4, 6, 8, ...). "

I personally think you could shorten that part to something like this:
"Your customers have lined up so that every second customer orders tea (2nd, 4th, 6th, ...)"

But that's just my preference. I think it's a great idea for a clash. :D

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: A great example of the application prime numbers
The concept is fun, but I think you should clarify that only one out of two customers orders tea. When I read it first, I thought every customer ordered tea after the second one.

It's a fun clash. I like the problem idea and the way it is presented. 
Finding primes in shortest mode should get amazing competition. 
Looks good to me.

Goal section
* Please specify the following if I understand correctly:
   • The customers are counted starting from 1.
   • The first customer orders tea.

* I don't understand your example. My logic is as follows. Please tell me where I go wrong.
   • Customer 1 - orders tea but is not prime
   • Customer 2 - is prime but does not order tea
   • Customer 3 - orders tea and is prime (count = 1)
   • Customer 4 - is not prime and does not order tea
   • Customer 5 - orders tea and is prime (count = 2)
   • Customer 6 - is not prime and does not order tea
   • Customer 7 - orders tea and is prime (count = 3)
   • Customer 8 - is not prime and does not order tea
   • Customer 9 - orders tea but is not prime
   • Customer 10 - is not prime and does not order tea
   • Customer 11 - orders tea and is prime (count = 4)
   • Customer 12 - is not prime and does not order tea
   • => so the answer is 4?

Thanks.
Thanks for your input! My idea was to only count every other customer and with those outputs (2,4,6,...) only every prime number of these gets a T-Shirt. Added an example.
Thanks for your input. I added a clarification.
Thank you frie for your input! I think your version is shorter and clear so I changed it.
Thank you tocar. I rewrote the sentence and corrected it.
OK, that makes more sense now. Thanks.
